greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of divisors d of n where d > sqrt(n).
comment: a(n) = n if n is prime because sigma(n) = n+1 and A066839(n) = 1;
a(p^2) = p^2 if p is prime because sigma(p^2) = p^2+p+1 and A066839(p^2)= p+1 => A000203(p^2) - A066839(p^2)= p^2;
a(m) = 2*m if m = A182147(n) = 42, 54, 66, 78, 102, 114,... (numbers n equal to the sum of its proper divisors greater than square root of n).
link: Michel Lagneau, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*(d>sqrt(n))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 28 2014
return sum([d for d in Integer(n).divisors() if d>sqrt(n)]) # _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 08 2014
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Feb 28 2014
